p: Additional important public health activities to address climate change include ( a) raising awareness, educating, and encouraging ongoing communication for other health professionals, policy makers, and the general public; ( b) performing and supporting research on the health impacts of climate change and on approaches to protecting public health; ( c) investigating disease outbreaks that may be related to climate change, such as outbreaks of vector-borne disease; ( d) assessing the vulnerability and the resilience of communities in the face of climate change; ( e) evaluating mitigation, adaptation, and other measures; and ( f) promoting increases in the resources and capacities of state and local health departments to address climate change.
